paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the KCNH2 gene associated with Type 2 Long QT Syndrome, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient P1 experienced syncope and palpitations at age 20.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with LQT2 after family screening
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 was diagnosed with LQT2 after family screening at age 29.
Patient P3 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: had a cardiac event leading to diagnosis
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 had a cardiac event at age 35 leading to diagnosis.

functional_data.summary: Mutations R531Q and R531W altered Kv11.1 current activation and inactivation.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the functional impact of KCNH2 mutations on cardiac action potential.
key_quotes: These are the first data to demonstrate that coexpressing wild type can correct activation and inactivation dysfunction caused by mutations at a critical voltage-sensing residue in Kv11.1.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P5 was diagnosed after syncopal episodes at age 22.
Patient P6 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: Mutations R531Q and R531W altered Kv11.1 current activation and inactivation.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the functional impact of KCNH2 mutations on cardiac action potential.
key_quotes: These are the first data to demonstrate that coexpressing wild type can correct activation and inactivation dysfunction caused by mutations at a critical voltage-sensing residue in Kv11.1.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P7 was diagnosed after cardiac arrest at age 28.
Patient P8 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.
